markFilter.title: Filter Options
markFilter.emptyDesc: If you confirm that any point info is missing or incorrect, please contact the administrators in the our community, or submit an Issue on our GitHub repository.

language.title: language
language.fullSupportHint: Complete translations for both UI and in-game content.
language.uiOnlyHint: UI translations only, in-game content will be displayed in English.
language.fyi: If your language is not yet available on this website, you can contact the site administrator via email at translate@opendfieldmap.org, or visit GitHub to participate in our open-source translation project. You can request translation entries for your language and assist with translating and localizing the WIKI section according to our guidelines. We sincerely appreciate and look forward to your contributions. You can also click to view the list of translation contributors.

tos.title: Terms & Storage
tos.policy:
We use Cookies to store your auto-login information; LocalStorage to store your UI preferences and marker progress; and CacheStorage to store font data and image resources for your language. These files allow you to access the website more quickly in the future and ensure the website's availability when offline.

Deleting the website's local storage can save space on your device. However, it may take longer to load these files when you visit again; if you disable website storage, the website will not be able to automatically record your data for your next use.

We do not report your data to the server, so you do not need to worry about privacy issues.

You can decide whether to enable local storage.
tos.warning:
Warning: If you clear stored data, your auto-login information, UI preferences, and marker progress will be lost; and it may take longer than usual to load the website next time.

If confirmed, please click the delete button again.

uiPrefs.title: UI Preferences
uiPrefs.hint: Select the UI state you want to keep. We recommend keeping all options for a more consistent experience.

mapPrefs.title: Map Preferences
mapPrefs.hint: Select the map storage and automatic optimization you want to enable. We recommend enabling all options for a more consistent experience.

theme.title: Theme Preferences
theme.hint: Choose your preferred theme. For AUTO, the theme will switch according to your device's preference.

guide.welcome:
Welcome to OPEN ENDFIELD MAP.
This is your first time using this map. We will provide you with a brief guided tour to help you quickly understand the various features of the map.

You can click the 'Skip' button at any time to end the guide, or restart it from the help button in the top bar.
guide.sidebarToggle:
Click to expand the sidebar.
The sidebar includes your most frequently used marker filters and switches closely related to marker display.
guide.search: You can search for markers to view using languages supported by the game and select them in the search results.
guide.filterContainer:
Markers of the same type are grouped in a filter.
Click to expand the list of markers of that type.
guide.filterSort:
Hold the ICON on the left of the filter to enter drag mode.
You can sort the filters important to you according to your needs.
guide.selectorSelect:
Specific marker selector. Click to toggle selection status; selected markers will appear on the map.
You can see the total number of such markers in the current area, as well as the number you have marked.

You can also hold and drag in the blank area of the sidebar to perform box selection on multiple marker selectors at once, allowing you to quickly toggle their selection status in batches.
guide.selectorComplete: When all markers of this type are marked as complete, the selector will change to completed status for quick judgment of marking progress.
guide.triggerHandle:
Switches related to map display are located at the bottom of the sidebar.
You can hold the mouse to drag and operate them.
guide.triggerSwitch:
Click to toggle switch status.
  • Marker Clustering Mode allows dense markers to be displayed merged;
  • Region Boundary Display highlights every sub-region and its boundaries within the current area.
  • Region Name shows in-game region names.
guide.scale:
Use the Zoom Control to view and manipulate map zoom.
Scroll wheel or trackpad can be used to zoom. You can also zoom by clicking the +/- buttons or anywhere on the zoom bar.
guide.filterList: The Marker List lists the markers you have selected; click the icon to deselect.
guide.headbar: Switches related to map settings are located in the header bar.
guide.tos: The website's Terms of Service and Data Management.
guide.hideUI: Hide Website UI to take screenshots or view edge markers.
guide.group: View discussion groups and communities related to this project.
guide.darkMode: Toggle the current ambient light mode.
guide.language:
Switch interface language.
Languages with full game content translation support include English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Korean, French, German, Italian, Russian, Spanish, Indonesian, Portuguese, Thai, and Vietnamese.
UI-only languages (interface translations only) include Arabic, Malay, and Polish.
guide.settings: Open Preferences to control which local storage the map uses to remember your actions.
guide.regionSwitch: Click to switch between different sandbox maps (main regions) in the game.
guide.subregionSwitch:
Hover over the main region icon to show available sub-regions; clicking a sub-region icon will jump to that sub-region view.
Similarly, you can also select a layer for a region.
guide.layerMain: Click the layer icon to return to the main layer (M) at any time.
guide.layerSwitch:
Hover over the layer icon to display available layers for the current region; click a layer to switch to that view.
Different layers may show different floors or heights of the map, helping you explore multi-level areas.
guide.pointSelect: Click a marker to enter selected status. You will be able to view the marker's information.
guide.pointMark: Click the marker again to mark it as complete.
guide.detail: You can view specific information about the selected marker, including the number of markers of this type in all regions, the current main region, and the current sub-region.
guide.pointIcon: Clicking the marker icon can also mark it as complete.

mobile.headbar: Switches related to map settings are located in the top-right corner header bar. Click the top-right icon to expand and see more options.
mobile.regionLayerSwitch:
Click region icons to switch between different sandbox maps (main regions).
Tap and hold a main region icon to display available sub-regions and layers, then select a sub-region or layer to jump to that view.
mobile.divider:
This is a draggable divider.
You can drag the divider left or right to adjust the width ratio between the search bar and marker list, adapting to your usage preferences.
mobile.drawer:
Swipe up from the bottom of the screen to open the drawer and view marker filters.
Here you can select which marker types you want to display on the map.
mobile.selectorSelect:
Specific marker selector. Tap to toggle selection status; selected markers will appear on the map.
You can see the total number of such markers in the current area, as well as the number you have marked.

notice.legacy:
Note: When the game version is 1.0.13, the map dataset version is 0.8.25. We need time to update the data, so updates may arrive later than the game patch. Thank you for your patience. To track our updates, please join our Discord Server.

We also recommend the following tools:
  • Game Wiki: https://warfarin.wiki
  • Blueprints: https://talospioneers.com
notice.uptodate: Map data is up to date.

meta.title: Open Endfield Map
meta.description: Open Endfield Map is an open-source online map for Arknights: Endfield, providing interactive maps, item collection, and strategic planning tools for players.

support.title: Support Us
support.content:
In just the past three days, Open Endfield Map has processed over 10 MILLION HTTPS requests daily (approx. 115 requests/sec), consuming 450GB+ of bandwidth. We are seeing about 7,000 new active users every day. While Cloudflare absorbs most of the load (huge thanks to them!), our origin server in Singapore is running at full capacity. Thank you for your incredible enthusiasm!

OEM has been open-source and free since February 2025. It is developed and maintained solely by me (Jacy Chan/Cirisus) in most of the time (and for now!) With the massive surge in traffic and the constant need for updates, managing this alone is becoming a challenge. If this site helps your exploration, please consider supporting the project. Funds go directly to server costs and future features (like user accounts and community marker uploads).

If you spot any data, UI, or translation errors, please send feedback—I'll fix them ASAP. Thank you for your understanding and support!
support.hint: We recommend Ko-fi for global users, and Afdian for users in mainland China.
